title: #MeToo for men: 'I'm a 9-year-old boy, he comes into my room, he rapes me, 43 years of silence'
summary: Writers, TV presenters, politicians... Following years of silence, men are finding the courage to speak out about the sexual violence they have suffered. This quiet breaking of silence began six months ago in France with the hashtag #MeTooGarçons.

title: France bids farewell to Olympics with parade on Champs-Elysées
summary: Athletes, volunteers, and workers will parade on the Champs-Elysées on Saturday evening, in a celebration that will include a concert at the Arc de Triomphe monument.

title: Thousands in France march in support of Gisèle Pelicot and protest of 'rape culture'
summary: Protesters took to the streets across the country in solidarity with the woman who was drugged by her husband for nearly ten years so he and other men could rape her in her sleep.

title: Storm Boris sweeps through eastern and central Europe
summary: The storm has triggered floods, unusually strong winds and torrential rains across areas of Austria, the Czech Republic, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, and Romania, where the flooding has claimed lives and damaged thousands of homes.

title: Three Americans, two Spaniards held over alleged plot to attack Maduro and 'destabilize' Venezuela
summary: Interior Minister Diosdado Cabello said that the five were held on suspicion of planning an attack on President Nicolas Maduro and his government, but a State Department spokesperson says the allegations are 'categorically false.'

title: In the Los Angeles area, the authorities are rushing to fight the Bridge Fire: 'This fire is really bad'
summary: In just a few days, three major wildfires broke out within a radius of less than 100 kilometers around the metropolitan area, fanned by a drought that is taking its toll on abundant vegetation.

title: Sixteen dead in tanker truck explosion in Haiti
summary: The 40 people injured were transported to Sainte Therese Hospital in the port city of Miragoane, about 100 kilometers west of the capital Port-au-Prince.

title: Ukraine's legalization of medical cannabis is a source of hope for veterans
summary: A medical and social revolution, the authorization of the plant's use for medicinal purposes could bring relief to soldiers suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder and amputees.

title: Brazil suffocates beneath smoke from record fires
summary: The country has turned into a vast inferno, with at least 11.3 million hectares devastated this year, almost 10 times the size of the Paris region. More than 60% of Brazil is covered by smoke, which is also spreading to neighboring countries.

title: Le Pen 'convinced' there will be new elections next year
summary: Just over two months after France's parliamentary elections led to a three-way split in the Assemblée National, far-right leader Marine Le Pen said the situation is 'untenable' and expects President Emmanuel Macron to call new elections as soon the Constitution allows, in 10 months.

title: 'We are all Gisèle!': Feminist rallies across France in response to the Mazan rape trial
summary: In Paris, Bordeaux and Strasbourg on Saturday, thousands of people showed their support for Gisèle Pelicot and all rape victims. The leitmotif of this mobilization: 'shame must change sides.'

title: Biden administration, behind declared solidarity with Ukraine, harbors hesitations
summary: The US has been reluctant to allow Kyiv to strike Russia with the long-range missiles its allies have supplied, fearing it might lead to escalation with Moscow.

title: Uganda holds funeral for murdered Olympian Rebecca Cheptegei
summary: The 33-year-old long-distance runner, who had died after being set on fire by her partner, was given a military funeral, including a gun salute. Her death has thrown a spotlight on what activists have called a femicide epidemic.

title: Pope Francis says Vatican knew for years about Abbé Pierre's sexual assaults
summary: The head of the Catholic Church acknowledged that Rome had been aware of the recently reported sexual violence perpetrated by the famous French priest at least since his death in 2007.

title: The mosquito war between the two Koreas
summary: The demilitarized zone, a no man's land along the border between South and North Korea, is at the heart of a new battle. Seoul is deploying an anti-mosquito arsenal to protect itself from malaria, a disease that is endemic in the neighboring country.

title: Typhoon Yagi's devastating consequences in 15 photos
summary: Four days after the passage of Typhoon Yagi, Vietnam, Myanmar and Thailand can only observe the extent of the damage. The latest regional death toll is at least 280.

title: Four IS group leaders killed in Iraq raid last month, US says
summary: The United States has some 2,500 troops in Iraq and 900 in Syria as part of the international coalition against the Islamic State group.

title: Who is the businessman plastering Paris with ads for his concert you can't attend?
summary: Omar Harfouch, a businessman with a mysterious fortune, will play the piano at the Théâtre des Champs-Elysées in Paris for his 'Concerto for Peace.' He financed the promotional campaign, but no tickets are on sale.

title: Former president Alberto Fujimori remains divisive in Peru, even after his death
summary: To the outrage of some Peruvians, the authorities have declared three days of national mourning in tribute to the former autocrat, who died on September 11.

title: China resolves to raise retirement age
summary: The Chinese will have to work between three and five years longer. In a sign of the sensitivity of the subject, the reform will go into effect very gradually.

title: Storm, flooding death toll in Myanmar jumps to 74: Local media
summary: The floods have heaped more misery on the country where war has raged since the military seized power in 2021. More than 2.7 million people were already displaced in Myanmar by the conflict.

title: Syrian Diaries: Journey through a shattered country
summary: 'Syrian Diaries' (Part 1/7): Piecemeal reconstruction, economic and social decay, millions of internally displaced persons. For people in Aleppo, Homs, Palmyra and the suburbs of Damascus, areas under the control of Bashar al-Assad's regime, daily life is an ordeal.

title: Paris bids farewell to Olympics with Champs-Elysées parade: 'It's a bit hard that it's all over'
summary: The French athletes' and volunteers' parade prolonged, for one final night, the excitement seen during the Olympic and Paralympic Games.

title: 'Several migrants' die trying to cross Channel, say French authorities
summary: Authorities said numerous attempts to make the crossing have taken place in recent days.

title: SpaceX Polaris Dawn private space mission returns to earth
summary: The Dragon spacecraft, which took a four-member team up to space, to conduct the first non-government spacewalk and science experiments, splashed down near Florida, concluding tech billionaire Jason Isaacman's second of four chartered spaceflights.

title: In Japan, a Korean anthem doesn't go down well
summary: The victory of Kyoto International High School, a school to educate the children of Korean expatriates, in the national high school baseball tournament has prompted a wave of criticism from the country's nationalist fringe.

title: The first time Le Monde wrote JK Rowling
summary: In recent years, the British author has gone from creating Harry Potter to making repeated transphobic remarks, including attacking sprinter Valentina Petrillo during the Paralympics. The novelist's name first appeared in Le Monde on January 29, 1999.

title: French mass rape trial: What exactly is 'chemical submission'?
summary: The use of drugs to perpetrate sexual assaults has been on the rise over the past 20 years, according to the National Agency for Medicine Safety (ANSM).

title: Typhoon Bebinca strikes Philippines, Japan, and soon China
summary: The tropical storm, with windspeeds over 198 kilometers per hour, has led to several deaths in the Philippines areas of Malabang and Zamboanga, as well as displacing around 13,000 people. All flights at Shanghai's two major airports have been canceled.

title: Germany's toughening on immigration sparks tense debate in Europe
summary: Germany has decided to re-establish border controls and has deported Afghan immigrants. While some EU member states have criticized it for going it alone, supporters of the 'Fortress Europe' idea have welcomed the policy change.

title: 2024 US election: Donald Trump's strange strategy of ignoring moderates
summary: The Republican candidate, more used to a golf cart than a shopping cart, didn't exploit economic issues in the televised debate against Kamala Harris, who adopted a calm, centrist line, designed to appeal to undecided voters neglected by her opponent.
